dcterms:title: Change in Digital Cognitive Test Performance between Solanezumab and Placebo Groups in Preclinical Alzheimer’s Disease: Secondary Analyses from the A4 Study
dcterms:abstract: This study investigates the effect of solanezumab on cognitive performance in a longitudinal trial involving cognitively unimpaired older adults at risk for Alzheimer's disease. Results showed no significant differences in cognitive decline between solanezumab and placebo groups over a 240-week period.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Introduction
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: In cognitively unimpaired older adults, abnormally high levels of amyloid (Aβ+) indicate biological changes characteristic of Alzheimer's disease. This study aims to assess whether solanezumab treatment affects cognitive decline.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Methods
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: Participants were randomly assigned to receive either solanezumab or placebo. Cognitive tests were performed at baseline and every 6 months.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Results
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: The study found no significant difference in the C3 Summary Score between treatment groups over the period of 240 weeks, indicating that solanezumab did not influence cognitive decline.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Discussion
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: This study reinforces the finding that solanezumab does not slow cognitive decline despite a decrease in amyloid levels.

cito:cites.dcterms:title: Evaluating the efficacy of new therapies in Alzheimer’s
